g.title: cluster_Validating input and checking its representation
Least privilege_Software should be given only those privileges that it needs to complete its task
g.text: Software should be given only those privileges that it needs to complete its task

g.title: cluster_Least privilege->Least privilege_Software should be given only those privileges that it needs to complete its task

Fail-safe defaults_The initial state should be to deny access unless access is explicitly required. Then, unless software is given explicit access to an object, it should be denied access to that object and the protection state of the system should remain unchanged
g.text: The initial state should be to deny access unless access is explicitly required. Then, unless software is given explicit access to an object, it should be denied access to that object and the protection state of the system should remain unchanged

g.title: cluster_Fail-safe defaults->Fail-safe defaults_The initial state should be to deny access unless access is explicitly required. Then, unless software is given explicit access to an object, it should be denied access to that object and the protection state of the system should remain unchanged
Complete mediation_Software should validate every access to objects to ensure that the access is allowed
g.text: Software should validate every access to objects to ensure that the access is allowed

g.title: cluster_Complete mediation->Complete mediation_Software should validate every access to objects to ensure that the access is allowed
Separation_Software should not grant access to a resource, or take a security-relevant action, based on a single condition
g.text: Software should not grant access to a resource, or take a security-relevant action, based on a single condition

g.title: cluster_Separation->Separation_Software should not grant access to a resource, or take a security-relevant action, based on a single condition
Minimize trust_Software should check all inputs and the results of all security-relevant actions
g.text: Software should check all inputs and the results of all security-relevant actions

g.title: cluster_Minimize trust->Minimize trust_Software should check all inputs and the results of all security-relevant actions
Economy of mechanism_Security features of software should be as simple as possible
g.text: Security features of software should be as simple as possible

g.title: cluster_Economy of mechanism->Economy of mechanism_Security features of software should be as simple as possible
Minimize common mechanism_The sharing of resources should be reduced as much as possible
g.text: The sharing of resources should be reduced as much as possible

g.title: cluster_Minimize common mechanism->Minimize common mechanism_The sharing of resources should be reduced as much as possible
Least astonishment_Security features of software, and security mechanisms it implements, should be designed so that their operation is as logical and simple as possible
g.text: Security features of software, and security mechanisms it implements, should be designed so that their operation is as logical and simple as possible

g.title: cluster_Least astonishment->Least astonishment_Security features of software, and security mechanisms it implements, should be designed so that their operation is as logical and simple as possible
Open design_Security of software, and of what that software provides, should not depend on the secrecy of its design or implementation
g.text: Security of software, and of what that software provides, should not depend on the secrecy of its design or implementation

g.title: cluster_Open design->Open design_Security of software, and of what that software provides, should not depend on the secrecy of its design or implementation

Layering_Organize software in layers so that modules at a given layer interact only with modules in the layers immediately above and below it. This allows you to test the software one layer at a time, using either topdown or bottom-up techniques, and reduces the access points, enforcing the principle of separation
g.text: Organize software in layers so that modules at a given layer interact only with modules in the layers immediately above and below it. This allows you to test the software one layer at a time, using either topdown or bottom-up techniques, and reduces the access points, enforcing the principle of separation

g.title: cluster_Layering->Layering_Organize software in layers so that modules at a given layer interact only with modules in the layers immediately above and below it. This allows you to test the software one layer at a time, using either topdown or bottom-up techniques, and reduces the access points, enforcing the principle of separation
Abstraction_Hide the internals of each layer, making only the interfaces available; this enables you to change how a layer carries out its tasks without affecting components at other layers
g.text: Hide the internals of each layer, making only the interfaces available; this enables you to change how a layer carries out its tasks without affecting components at other layers

g.title: cluster_Abstraction->Abstraction_Hide the internals of each layer, making only the interfaces available; this enables you to change how a layer carries out its tasks without affecting components at other layers
Modularity_Design and implement the software as a collection of co-operating components (modules); indeed, each module interface is an abstraction
g.text: Design and implement the software as a collection of co-operating components (modules); indeed, each module interface is an abstraction

g.title: cluster_Modularity->Modularity_Design and implement the software as a collection of co-operating components (modules); indeed, each module interface is an abstraction
Complete linkage_Tie software security design and implementation to the security specifications for that software
g.text: Tie software security design and implementation to the security specifications for that software

g.title: cluster_Complete linkage->Complete linkage_Tie software security design and implementation to the security specifications for that software

Design for iteration_Plan the design in such a way that it can be changed, if needed. This minimizes the effects with respect to the security of changing the design if the specifications do not match an environment that the software is used in
g.text: Plan the design in such a way that it can be changed, if needed. This minimizes the effects with respect to the security of changing the design if the specifications do not match an environment that the software is used in

g.title: cluster_Design for iteration->Design for iteration_Plan the design in such a way that it can be changed, if needed. This minimizes the effects with respect to the security of changing the design if the specifications do not match an environment that the software is used in

Derivation of security requirements_Beginning with business, mission, or other objectives, determine what security requirements are necessary to succeed. These may also be derived, or changed, as the software evolves
g.text: Beginning with business, mission, or other objectives, determine what security requirements are necessary to succeed. These may also be derived, or changed, as the software evolves

g.title: cluster_Derivation of security requirements->Derivation of security requirements_Beginning with business, mission, or other objectives, determine what security requirements are necessary to succeed. These may also be derived, or changed, as the software evolves
Specification of security requirements_Translate the security requirements into a form that can be used (formal specification, informal specifications, specifications for testing)
g.text: Translate the security requirements into a form that can be used (formal specification, informal specifications, specifications for testing)

g.title: cluster_Specification of security requirements->Specification of security requirements_Translate the security requirements into a form that can be used (formal specification, informal specifications, specifications for testing)
Software development lifecycle/Security development lifecycle_Include the following examples- waterfall model, agile development and security
g.text: Include the following examples- waterfall model, agile development and security

g.title: cluster_Software development lifecycle/Security development lifecycle->Software development lifecycle/Security development lifecycle_Include the following examples- waterfall model, agile development and security
Programming languages and type-safe languages_Discuss the problems that programming languages introduce, what type-safety does, and why it is important
g.text: Discuss the problems that programming languages introduce, what type-safety does, and why it is important

g.title: cluster_Programming languages and type-safe languages->Programming languages and type-safe languages_Discuss the problems that programming languages introduce, what type-safety does, and why it is important
cluster_Validating input and checking its representation
g.text: Validating input and checking its representation

g.title: Validating input and checking its representation_Check bounds of buffers and values of integers to be sure they are in range
g.text: Check bounds of buffers and values of integers to be sure they are in range

g.title: cluster_Validating input and checking its representation->Validating input and checking its representation_Check bounds of buffers and values of integers to be sure they are in range
Validating input and checking its representation_Check inputs to make sure they are what is expected and will be processed/interpreted correctly
g.text: Check inputs to make sure they are what is expected and will be processed/interpreted correctly

g.title: cluster_Validating input and checking its representation->Validating input and checking its representation_Check inputs to make sure they are what is expected and will be processed/interpreted correctly
Using APIs correctly_Ensure parameters and environments are validated and controlled so that the API enforces the security policy properly
g.text: Ensure parameters and environments are validated and controlled so that the API enforces the security policy properly

g.title: cluster_Using APIs correctly->Using APIs correctly_Ensure parameters and environments are validated and controlled so that the API enforces the security policy properly
Using APIs correctly_Check the results of using the API for problems
g.text: Check the results of using the API for problems

g.title: cluster_Using APIs correctly->Using APIs correctly_Check the results of using the API for problems
cluster_Using security features->Using security features_Use cryptographic randomness
Using security features_Properly restrict process privileges
cluster_Using security features->Using security features_Properly restrict process privileges
Checking time and state relationships_Check that the file acted upon is the one for which the relevant attributes are checked
g.text: Check that the file acted upon is the one for which the relevant attributes are checked

g.title: cluster_Checking time and state relationships->Checking time and state relationships_Check that the file acted upon is the one for which the relevant attributes are checked
Checking time and state relationships_Check that processes run
cluster_Checking time and state relationships->Checking time and state relationships_Check that processes run
Handling exceptions and errors properly_Block or queue signals during signal processing, if necessary
g.text: Block or queue signals during signal processing, if necessary

g.title: cluster_Handling exceptions and errors properly->Handling exceptions and errors properly_Block or queue signals during signal processing, if necessary

Handling exceptions and errors properly_Determine what information should be given to the user, balancing usability with any need to hide some information, and how and to whom to report that information
g.text: Determine what information should be given to the user, balancing usability with any need to hide some information, and how and to whom to report that information

g.title: cluster_Handling exceptions and errors properly->Handling exceptions and errors properly_Determine what information should be given to the user, balancing usability with any need to hide some information, and how and to whom to report that information
Programming robustly_This topic is sometimes called secure or defensive programming
g.text: This topic is sometimes called secure or defensive programming

g.title: cluster_Programming robustly->Programming robustly_This topic is sometimes called secure or defensive programming
cluster_Programming robustly->Programming robustly_Only deallocate allocated memory
cluster_Programming robustly->Programming robustly_Initialize variables before use
Programming robustly_Don't rely on undefined behavior
cluster_Programming robustly->Programming robustly_Don't rely on undefined behavior
Encapsulating structures and modules_This topic includes classes and other instantiations
g.text: This topic includes classes and other instantiations

g.title: cluster_Encapsulating structures and modules->Encapsulating structures and modules_This topic includes classes and other instantiations
Encapsulating structures and modules_Example- isolating processes
cluster_Encapsulating structures and modules->Encapsulating structures and modules_Example- isolating processes
Taking environment into account_Example- don't put sensitive information in the source code
g.text: Example- don't put sensitive information in the source code

g.title: cluster_Taking environment into account->Taking environment into account_Example- don't put sensitive information in the source code

Static and dynamic analysis_The different methods for each of these, includes how static and dynamic analysis work together, and the limits and benefits of each, as well as how to perform these types of analyses on very large software systems
g.text: The different methods for each of these, includes how static and dynamic analysis work together, and the limits and benefits of each, as well as how to perform these types of analyses on very large software systems

g.title: cluster_Static and dynamic analysis->Static and dynamic analysis_The different methods for each of these, includes how static and dynamic analysis work together, and the limits and benefits of each, as well as how to perform these types of analyses on very large software systems
Unit testing_How to test component parts of the software, like modules
g.text: How to test component parts of the software, like modules

g.title: cluster_Unit testing->Unit testing_How to test component parts of the software, like modules
Integration testing_How to test the software components as they are integrated
g.text: How to test the software components as they are integrated

g.title: cluster_Integration testing->Integration testing_How to test the software components as they are integrated
Software testing_How to test the software as a whole, and place unit and integration testing in a proper framework
g.text: How to test the software as a whole, and place unit and integration testing in a proper framework

g.title: cluster_Software testing->Software testing_How to test the software as a whole, and place unit and integration testing in a proper framework
Configuring_This topic covers how to set up the software system to make it function correctly
g.text: This topic covers how to set up the software system to make it function correctly

g.title: cluster_Configuring->Configuring_This topic covers how to set up the software system to make it function correctly
Patching and the vulnerability lifecycle_This topic includes managing vulnerability reports, fixing the vulnerabilities, testing the patch and patch distribution
g.text: This topic includes managing vulnerability reports, fixing the vulnerabilities, testing the patch and patch distribution

g.title: cluster_Patching and the vulnerability lifecycle->Patching and the vulnerability lifecycle_This topic includes managing vulnerability reports, fixing the vulnerabilities, testing the patch and patch distribution
Checking environment_This topic covers ensuring the environment matches the assumptions made in the software, and if not, how to handle the conflict
g.text: This topic covers ensuring the environment matches the assumptions made in the software, and if not, how to handle the conflict

g.title: cluster_Checking environment->Checking environment_This topic covers ensuring the environment matches the assumptions made in the software, and if not, how to handle the conflict
DevOps_This topic combines development and operation, and the automation and monitoring of both
g.text: This topic combines development and operation, and the automation and monitoring of both

g.title: cluster_DevOps->DevOps_This topic combines development and operation, and the automation and monitoring of both
Decommissioning/Retiring_What happens when the software is removed, and how to remove it without causing security problems
g.text: What happens when the software is removed, and how to remove it without causing security problems

g.title: cluster_Decommissioning/Retiring->Decommissioning/Retiring_What happens when the software is removed, and how to remove it without causing security problems
Installation documents_This topic includes installation and configuration documentation
g.text: This topic includes installation and configuration documentation

g.title: cluster_Installation documents->Installation documents_This topic includes installation and configuration documentation
User guides and manuals_This topic includes tutorials and cheat sheets (brief guides); these should emphasize any potential security problems the users can cause
g.text: This topic includes tutorials and cheat sheets (brief guides); these should emphasize any potential security problems the users can cause

g.title: cluster_User guides and manuals->User guides and manuals_This topic includes tutorials and cheat sheets (brief guides); these should emphasize any potential security problems the users can cause
Assurance documentation_This topic focuses on how correctness was established, and what correctness means here
g.text: This topic focuses on how correctness was established, and what correctness means here

g.title: cluster_Assurance documentation->Assurance documentation_This topic focuses on how correctness was established, and what correctness means here
Security documentation_This topic focuses on potential security problems, how to avoid them, and if they occur, what the effects might be and how to deal with them
g.text: This topic focuses on potential security problems, how to avoid them, and if they occur, what the effects might be and how to deal with them

g.title: cluster_Security documentation->Security documentation_This topic focuses on potential security problems, how to avoid them, and if they occur, what the effects might be and how to deal with them

cluster_Deployment and Maintenance->cluster_Patching and the vulnerability lifecycle
